description: The centre of the board is the region in which pieces are typically at their

A bishop placed in the centre can see to all four corners,
and a knight will not have its movement blocked by the edges of the board.
This makes the centre a

discovered_attacks.title: Discovered Attacks
description: A type of
in which a direct attack by one piece is revealed when another piece or pawn is moved out of its way.
In this
from Petrov's Defense, Black makes a blunder with 4. ...Nf6??, allowing White to
play the discovered attack Nc6+.
By moving the knight out of the way, White's queen now sees Black's king, and since this creates a check,
White's knight is safe from immediate capture while Black spends their move blocking the check.
White may then capture Black's queen with the knight on their next move.
